metadata.title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a danglingpointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited byProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write intofreed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems wherethe X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xserver-common - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
xvfb - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.7').
xwayland package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.5').
